Name.BusinessNameLine1: CHARLES A CANNON JR MEMORIAL HOSPITAL INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE COMMUNITY OF LINVILLE, NORTH CAROLINA. THIS INCLUDES A BEHAVORIAL HEALTH CENTER, NEW LIFE CENTER, PATIENT CARE CENTER, DIAGNOSTIC SERVICES, EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT AND A CRITICAL CARE UNIT.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE COMMUNITY OF LINVILLE, NORTH CAROLINA. THIS INCLUDES A BEHAVORIAL HEALTH CENTER, NEW LIFE CENTER, PATIENT CARE CENTER, DIAGNOSTIC SERVICES, EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT AND A CRITICAL CARE UNIT.

Form990ScheduleHPartIV.DescriptionEntPrimaryActivity: SOLE MEMBER OF CHARLES A. CANNON JR., MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, INC.

Name.BusinessNameLine1: charles a cannon jr memorial hospital

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: AN ALLOWANCE FOR UNCOLLECTIBLE ACCOUNTS IS RECORDED BASED ON HISTORICAL BAD DEBT EXPERIENCE AND MANAGEMENT'S EVALUATION OF THE ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE. BALANCES ARE WRITTEN OFF AFTER ALL REASONABLE COLLECTION EFFORTS HAVE BEEN MADE.WE ESTIMATE 5% OF CHARITY COSTS FAIRLY ESTIMATE AMOUNTS INCLUDED AS BAD DEBT THAT WOULD BE ELIGIBLE FOR CHARITY CARE BUT FAILED TO APPLY.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: Part III, Line 9b: CHARITY WRITE-OFFS ARE SEGREGATED FROM NORMAL BAD DEBTS THROUGH A SEPARATE TRANSACTION CODE. FAMILY INCOME BELOW 175% OF FPG ARE ELIGIBLE FOR 100% WRITE-OFF. PARTIAL WRITE-OFF IS AVAILABLE BETWEEN FAMILY INCOME BETWEEN 175% AND 250% OF FPG.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Parent company, Appalachian Regional Health Care System (ARHS) oversees CMH operations. also note that salaries and other common expenses incurred by ARHS are allocated appropriately to cmh and the other entites supported by arhs. this is why salaries expenses is reported even though no employees are listed. All wages and payments to vendors are paid out through ARHS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Approval may be needed by the parent company, Appalachian Regional Health Care System.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The svp/cfo and the system director of finance review the 990 and then it is made available to the board upon completion.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: review of policy statement each year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Independent compensation and benefit analysis was performed by Findley Davies in late 2009. The Executive Committee (Compensation Committee) reviewed this information in January, 2010 to establish appropriateness of total compensation, comply with Intermediate Sanction regulations, and determine excutive compensation for CEO, COO, and CFO positions. Organization's officers and key employees are compensated through ARHS. No W-2s are paid out through Charles A. Cannon Jr., Memorial Hospital.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: employment alternative to both new and established physician practices
hold future purchase of non-profit land acquisitions
